info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 7:03AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT CHEYENNE AND SOUTHWESTERN KIT CARSON COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO...WICHITA...SOUTHERN WALLACE...SOUTHERN LOGAN...GREELEY AND GOVE COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL KANSAS... At 701 AM MST/801 AM CST/, a large area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Collyer to 10 miles south of Weskan to 3 miles east of Arriba. Movement was south at 20 mph. Spotter in Kit Carson, Colorado reported one half mile in visbility due to blowing snow. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Leoti, Quinter, Cheyenne Wells, Tribune, Flagler, Gove, and Kit Carson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 102 and 112. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 398. Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 163. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this area of heavy snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling. &&
